str.o: Database URL

This database to connect to as a database URL in the format
driver://user name:password@host:port/database.
Passwords are crypted
If set, passwords are stored encrypted with the Unix crypt funtion. If not, passwords are stored in clear text.
Table
This is the table that contains the data. It must contain the columns username and passwd and can contain the optional columns uid, gid, gecos (the full name of the user), homedir and shell.
Disable user list

If this is turned on, it won't be possible to get a listing of all users. Usually the User file system module makes it possible to list all users on the system. If you have a large number of users this can take a lot of resourses.
Cache entries

If set, the module will cache database entries. Without this cache the module might well needs to make a database query per access. This option is therefore highly recommended. The drawback is changes to the database will not show up immediately.
Close the database if not used
This option closes the database connection upon to long inactivity. Saves resourses for sites that are not used very frequently.
Database close timeout
The inactivity time, in seconds, before the database connection is closed.
Defaults: User ID
This is the uid that will be returned if a uid field is not present in the database table.
Defaults: Group ID
This is the gid that will be returned is a gid field is not present in the database table.
Defaults: Gecos
This is the gecos that will be returned if a gecos field is not present in the database table.
Defaults: Home directory
This is the home directory that will be returned if a homedir field is not present in the database table.
Defaults: Login shell
This is the login shell that will be returned if a shell field is not present in the database table.
SQL user database

This module implements user authentication via a SQL server.

For setup instruction, see the comments at the beginning of the module code.
